availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Lindsay (Hopkins Co., Ky, saddler, 17th ky cav. )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, saddler and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Pleasant Lindsay and Sarah J. Lindsay. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Student and saddler in Madisonville in 1860. Saddler in Hopkins County in 1865. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and saddler from January 3, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 49B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 829.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 404-5.
"William Wesley Lindsay (1843-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial #132521866, accessed August 4, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132521866.
